content:
### 3. Cancellation Refund
* **(a) For Single Return Trip policy**
    We may cancel the Policy at any time by giving seven (7) working days notification in writing to You at Your last known address. You may cancel the Policy before the start of Your Trip and We will refund You the premium You have paid less $25 for administrative charge. We will not refund You if any refund premium is less than $5 or a claim has been made under the Policy.
* **(b) For Annual Multi-Trip Policy**
    We may cancel the Policy at any time by giving seven (7) working days notification in writing to You at Your last known address. You may cancel the Policy at any time by giving seven (7) working days notification in writing to Us provided no claim has been made under the Policy. You will be entitled to a return of premium subject to the short period rates for the period the Policy has been in force as follows:
questions: How does the cancellation process differ between Single Return Trip and Annual Multi-Trip policies in terms of notification requirements, refund eligibility, and administrative charges?
Under what conditions will the insurer refuse to refund any premium for a Single Return Trip policy cancellation, and how does this compare to the Annual Multi-Trip policy cancellation terms?
What are the implications of making a claim under either the Single Return Trip or Annual Multi-Trip policy on the ability to cancel and receive a refund?
How is the refund amount calculated for an Annual Multi-Trip policy cancellation, and what role do short period rates play in this calculation?
What is the minimum refund amount threshold for the Single Return Trip policy, and how does this affect the refund process?
What are the notification requirements for the insurer to cancel either the Single Return Trip or Annual Multi-Trip policy, and how must this notification be delivered?
If a policyholder cancels an Annual Multi-Trip policy after a claim has been made, what are the consequences regarding refund eligibility?
How does the administrative charge apply to cancellations of the Single Return Trip policy, and is there a similar charge for the Annual Multi-Trip policy?
What is the required notice period for a policyholder to cancel an Annual Multi-Trip policy, and how does this compare to the insurer’s cancellation notice period?
In what scenarios would the refund premium be less than $5 for a Single Return Trip policy, and what is the insurer’s policy in such cases?
How does the policy define the start of the Trip for the purpose of cancellation and refund eligibility under the Single Return Trip policy?
What documentation or proof might be required to process a cancellation refund for either policy type, considering the notification and claim conditions?
How does the cancellation refund policy address situations where the policyholder cancels after the Trip has started for both Single Return Trip and Annual Multi-Trip policies?
What are the differences in refund entitlement when the insurer cancels the policy versus when the policyholder cancels it under both policy types?
How does the policy handle cancellation refunds if the policyholder moves and the insurer sends the cancellation notification to the last known address but it is not received?
What are the effects of the administrative charge on small premium amounts when cancelling a Single Return Trip policy, and how might this influence a policyholder’s decision to cancel?
How does the policy ensure fairness in refund calculations for Annual Multi-Trip policies when the policy is cancelled partway through the coverage period?
Are there any exceptions or exclusions that would override the cancellation refund provisions outlined for either policy type?
How do the cancellation refund provisions interact with other policy sections, such as claims for trip interruption or curtailment?
What are the policyholder’s rights and obligations regarding cancellation notifications and refunds if the policy is cancelled due to non-payment or breach of terms?
